definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Germany's population is ageing, and the birth rate falling.
sentences.chinese: 德国的人口老化，出生率下降。

sentences.english: There is a strong correlation between the rate of birth and the number of babies born out of wedlock.
sentences.chinese: 出生率和非婚生孩子之间存在很强的相关性。

sentences.english: All of these groups continue to have above-average birth rates.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些族群出生率将继续维持在平均以上。

sentences.english: They're more likely to have children of low birth rate and more birth complications.
sentences.chinese: 高龄人群可能会导致低出生率和更多的出生并发症。

sentences.english: This has easily offset the general decline in the birthrate of advanced countries.
sentences.chinese: 发达国家的出生率的普遍降低被轻易抵消。

sentences.english: Emigration and a high mortality rate among middle-aged men are part of the cause. But so is a low birthrate.
sentences.chinese: 移民和高死亡率是其中的一个原因，还有低出生率。

sentences.english: The resistance to the idea is caused by the falling of birthrates.
sentences.chinese: 人们反对这一看法来自于出生率的下降。

sentences.english: The war brought about a reduction in the birth-rate.
The fall of birthrate resulted in people's objection to the idea.
sentences.chinese: 人们反对这一看法来自于出生率的下降。

sentences.english: Reduction of competition for food stimulates both natality and survival.
sentences.chinese: 食物竞争的减少，刺激了出生率和存活力。

sentences.english: The new birthrate has decreased from last year's.
sentences.chinese: 新出生率与去年相比有所下降。

sentences.english: Recession means fewer babies; US births fell 2 pct.
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退使美国出生率降低2%。

sentences.english: European birthrates are not that much higher than Asian birth rates either.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的出生率也并不比亚洲的高多少。

sentences.english: Fetal macrosomia birthrate is about 15% in three years.
sentences.chinese: 近3年的巨大儿出生率在15%左右。

sentences.english: The low success rate was attributed to Hong Kong's low birth rate and small-class teaching.
sentences.chinese: 低成功率是由于出生率低和实施小班教学。

sentences.english: First, high birthrates cannot be altered substantially overnight.
sentences.chinese: 第一，高出生率不可能在一夜之内就被改变。

definition: percentage of children who enter school

pinyin: du2 sheng1 zi3 nu:3 zheng4 ce4

definition: rate of infection (usu. of a disease)
to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
